metadata.synopsis: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.

48.speaker: Rolan
48.text: We should have left by now. Damnation.
48.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated. Having a little bit of a tantrum, to be honest. Not used to not getting his way.

104.speaker: Rolan
104.text: Instead we're just sitting here - practically begging to be attacked. Staying is a mistake.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You're doing the right thing. The others need help.

69.speaker: Rolan
69.text: And what about us? There's every chance we've doomed ourselves by helping these people.

100.speaker: Rolan
100.text: We will end up fodder for some goblin's blade - all because Lia insists on helping every wounded foal we see.

89.speaker: Rolan
89.text: Our best chance to make it to Baldur's Gate is on our own. This place is lost.

20.speaker: Rolan
20.context: NodeContext: Player has asked why the hurry to the city. His career and his magic is more important to him than his life. This apprenticeship means EVERYTHING to him.

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: My apprenticeship with Lorroakan begins shortly. I cannot be late.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Leave on your own. Why wait?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Worrying won't help. I'm sure you'll be fine.

81.speaker: Rolan
81.text: Of course I will be. As if there was any doubt.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Standing by your people is never a mistake.

24.speaker: Rolan
24.text: It is if we end up dead.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: So eager to go to Baldur's Gate - do they even welcome tieflings?

75.speaker: Rolan
75.text: More than most. A few strangers may stare - but they'll keep their daggers sheathed.

11.speaker: Rolan
11.text: I'll be warmly received, besides. You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.

50.speaker: Rolan
50.text: I wonder what Lorroakan will have me do first? Complex magic, no doubt.

54.speaker: Rolan
54.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
54.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

112.speaker: Rolan
112.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

39.speaker: Rolan
39.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

56.speaker: Rolan
56.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Hold on. Why are you so eager to reach the city?

87.speaker: Rolan
87.text: Tch. You're as bad as Lia.

45.speaker: Rolan
45.text: And I think one of her is quite enough in my life. Good day to you.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: There's every chance you'll die on the road.

98.speaker: Rolan
98.text: Please. I can handle myself. It's others that are the issue.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You made the right choice. This place isn't safe.

92.speaker: Rolan
92.text: Quite right. Lia can be stubborn at times.

32.speaker: Rolan
32.text: This place, and its people, are lost. The only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is on our own.

70.speaker: Rolan
70.text: And we will make it. I know it.

38.speaker: Rolan
38.text: Other than a desire to avoid impending death?

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
2.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

23.speaker: Rolan
23.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
23.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: I've heard that name before. A young man, yes? Lives in Ramazith's Tower in the Upper City?

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: Word in Waterdeep has it he's a bit of a cad. But you say he's an accomplished wizard?

103.speaker: Rolan
103.text: Of course he is! The greatest spellcaster along the Sword Coast. As if I'd settle for a lesser mentor.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: In that case, I'd very much appreciate it if you could arrange an introduction should we reach the city.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Good idea: powerful acquaintances never hurt.

36.speaker: Rolan
36.text: If it's powerful acquaintances you're after, you have to look no further than yours truly.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Hold on. I'm not sure about this Lorroakan.

68.speaker: Rolan
68.text: Don't be fooled by mere gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: We need to go. We have a more pressing problem, remember?

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: Merely planning ahead. Besides, never hurts to befriend a wizard.

7.speaker: Rolan
7.text: In that case, it is I you should befriend.

18.speaker: Rolan
18.text: Few can match me - in either magic or talent.

79.speaker: Rolan
79.text: In years to come, you will boast of this meeting - I can assure you. May we meet again in Baldur's Gate, my friend.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I've heard stories about Lorroakan - not all of them good.

21.speaker: Rolan
21.text: Common gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

13.speaker: Rolan
13.text: I've admired Lorroakan for years. Never dreamed he'd answer my letter.
13.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses his hero. He looks and sounds younger in this moment. Pure enthusiasm and excitement.

28.speaker: Rolan
28.text: But I've worked myself to the bone for this. Few can match me - in either magic or talent.
28.context: NodeContext: Determined even as he's sounding overconfident. He has truly has worked his ass off to get here.

94.speaker: Rolan
94.text: The names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known far and wide. You'll see.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Never heard of him. Who is he?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: There are many things I feel I should know... but I don't.

83.speaker: Rolan
83.text: What? You don't know of him? I've admired him for years.
83.context: NodeContext: Pride and awe in his voice. He's clearly imagining himself in the same position.

14.speaker: Rolan
14.text: Forgive me. Of course someone like you wouldn't know.
14.context: NodeContext: You think you're being kind but you're just being a condescending dick

0.speaker: Rolan
0.text: Both his magic and political sway are forces to be reckoned with.

109.speaker: Rolan
109.text: Rest assured, the names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known to you soon enough. You'll see.
109.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shrug. Stating this like a fact.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Is this Lorroakan of Ramazith's Tower?

43.speaker: Rolan
43.text: His name is known far and wide, I see.
43.context: NodeContext: Player says the know the wizard he speaks of. Happily surprised to see.

27.speaker: Rolan
27.text: Few can match him in terms of raw power and talent. Until now, that is.
27.context: NodeContext: Smug and arrogant. He is powerful and he is talented. He's just smug about it.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I've heard he's quite the scoundrel.

101.speaker: Rolan
101.text: Common gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Perhaps the right master can rid you of your arrogance.

66.speaker: Rolan
66.text: Please - this is confidence, not arrogance.
66.context: NodeContext: Player has told him not be cocky. Dismissive of their words. He's good and he knows it.

99.speaker: Rolan
99.text: But thank you for your concern. It was touching.
99.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm. He's irritated by what he perceives as the player's criticism.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Why burden yourself with companions? You should slip away - alone.

88.speaker: Rolan
88.text: ... but I could never leave Lia behind, as irksome as she may be.

107.speaker: Rolan
107.text: If only she understood. The longer we wait, the longer the horrors of the wilds imperil us.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Baldur's Gate isn't going anywhere. Why the hurry?

19.speaker: Rolan
19.text: I have been offered an apprenticeship by none other than Lorroakan.

64.speaker: Rolan
64.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate. This will change everything.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You don't wish to help your fellow tieflings?

95.speaker: Rolan
95.text: If we stop and help every wounded foal, we'll end up dead, or worse. Lia just can't see it.

90.speaker: Rolan
90.text: We must leave soon. My apprenticeship with the wizard begins shortly.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: If you want to go, then go.

15.speaker: Rolan
15.text: Bah. I couldn't abandon her. No matter how prestigious the apprenticeship.
15.context: NodeContext: This clearly bothers you much more than you are trying to show. You love Lia but it pains you not to be in Baldur's Gate.

62.speaker: Rolan
62.text: I'm to study under Lorroakan, you see.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I've heard the Elfsong Tavern makes a mean bowl of stew.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You're leaving? Good. Save your own skin to fight another day.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: What's so special about Baldur's Gate? Everyone here is so focused on it.

5.speaker: Rolan
5.text: You are in for a treat, my otherworldly friend. There is no city in the Realms like Baldur's Gate.

29.speaker: Rolan
29.text: From its sights, to its smells, to the fortunes you can make. I myself am set to make history there...
29.context: NodeContext: very much enjoying the sound of your own voice

72.speaker: Rolan
72.text: ... as apprentice to Lorroakan, the greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate. This will change everything.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The aroma of the Outer City is pretty unique.

55.speaker: Rolan
55.text: As if I would be found in such a place. No, I am destined for greater things.

106.speaker: Rolan
106.text: My Thunderwave will make quick work of any goblin - just you wait.
